org.colomoto.common.xml

Class XMLWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.colomoto.common.xml.XMLWriter

  • public class XMLWriter
extends Object
    A helper to write well formed XML documents.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XMLWriter(OutputStream out, String dtdFile)
      Create an XML writer with indenting enabled by default.
      XMLWriter(OutputStreamWriter out, String dtdFile)
      Create an XML writer with indenting enabled by default.
      XMLWriter(String filename, String dtdFile)
      Create a XMLWriter with the path to a file.

      • XMLWriter

        public XMLWriter(String filename,
                 String dtdFile)
          throws IOException
        Create a XMLWriter with the path to a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the path to the output file
        dtdFile - path to the DTD file
        Throws:
        IOException - if the output can not be written or fails

      • XMLWriter

        public XMLWriter(OutputStreamWriter out,
                 String dtdFile)
          throws IOException
        Create an XML writer with indenting enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        out - the output writer
        dtdFile - path to the DTD file
        Throws:
        IOException - if the output can not be written or fails

                 String dtdFile)
          throws IOException
        Create an XML writer with indenting enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        out - the output stream
        dtdFile - path to the DTD file
        Throws:
        IOException - if the output can not be written or fails

    • Method Detail

      • isValidId

        public static boolean isValidId(String id)
        Indicates if the given string is a valid GINsim ID (contains only a-z, A-Z, 0-9, "_" or "-" characters)
        Parameters:
        id - the string to test
        Returns:
        true if the given string can be used as ID

      • toBuffer

        public void toBuffer()
              throws IOException
        ask to store the next calls into a string buffer. Use getBuffer() to stop it and get the content of the buffer.
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • getBuffer

        public String getBuffer()
        If toBuffer has previously been called, stop saving to buffer.
        Returns:
        the content of the buffer.

      • writeEsc

        public void writeEsc(String s,
                     boolean isAttVal)
              throws IOException
        Write a string, using escaping as needed.
        Parameters:
        s - the String to write
        isAttVal - specifies if this is an attribute value (uses a different escaping)
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addTag

        public void addTag(String name)
            throws IOException
        Add (i.e. open and close) a tag without any attributes and content.
        Parameters:
        name - the tag name
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addTag

        public void addTag(String name,
                   String[] attributes,
                   String content)
            throws IOException
        Add (i.e. open and close) a tag with specified attributes and content.
        Parameters:
        name - the tag name
        attributes - the list of attributes and their values
        content - the content text
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • openTag

        public void openTag(String name,
                    String[] attributes)
             throws IOException
        Open a tag and add it the specified attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - the tag name
        attributes - the list of attributes and their values
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addTag

        public void addTag(String name,
                   String[] attributes)
            throws IOException
        Add (i.e. open and close) a tag with specified attributes and no content.
        Parameters:
        name - the tag name
        attributes - the list of attributes and their values
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addTag

        public void addTag(String tag,
                   String content)
            throws IOException
        Add (i.e. open and close) a tag with specified content and no attributes.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag name
        content - the content to add
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • closeTag

        public void closeTag()
              throws IOException
        Close the currently opened tag. Depending on context it will use "/> or "</name>"
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addAttr

        public void addAttr(String name,
                    String value)
             throws IOException
        add an attribute to the opened tag. If the tag is no-more really opened it will return silently without writing anything.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute name
        value - the attribute value
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addContent

        public void addContent(String s)
                throws IOException
        Add a "text child"
        Parameters:
        s - the content to write (will be escaped as needed)
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addFormatedContent

        public void addFormatedContent(String s,
                               boolean b)
                        throws IOException
        Add a "text child", already formated: should _NOT_ be escaped
        Parameters:
        s - the formatted content
        b - if true, then the file might get indented
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • addComplexContent

        public void addComplexContent(String s,
                              boolean b)
                       throws IOException
        Add a complex "text child", it will be enclosed into CDATA markers
        Parameters:
        s - the complex content
        b - if true, then the file might get indented
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close the writer: automatically closes all open tags and the underlying output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails
